title: Sex could be the best option to calm flying fears
text:
Sex could be the best option to calm flying fears Last updated 11:46, September 16 2015 iStock 
Forget sleeping pills and hypnosis, sex might be the best anxiety killer for flying. 
Forget sleeping pills, meditation and hypnosis, sex might be the best option to calm flying fears. 
According to the Daily Mail, sex may provide the best results in curing anxious travellers who are scared of flying. 
The unusual theory has been put forward by Tom Bunn, a former US Air Force and commercial pilot who now counsels timid air travellers. 
Thankfully his theory has nothing to do with joining the exclusive mile high club, instead he argues that clients who have had sex the night before a flight simply forget about their anxiety. 
According to Bunn, a new study on chronic and post-traumatic stress supports the theory that sex can help lower a person's stress levels before boarding a flight. 
READ MORE: High anxiety: Conquering a fear of flying 
Bunn, founder of SOAR, said sex helped a male client who suffered a fear of flying for almost a decade. 
"Every time he flew he was totally miserable, except for one time when, before he came back from a business trip, he hooked up with someone. 
"He said they didn't get any sleep. They made love all night long and he dragged himself out of bed onto the aeroplane and had a perfectly anxiety-free flight." Bunn told Yahoo Travel. 
But although sex may be a quick-fix to help some frightened flyers, he concludes this it won't help travellers deal with with the cause of their anxiety.
